page.title: 06FIELD SPORTS - S of Waltham.
page.content: Hunting and shooting, both pheasant and partridge, are traditional pastimes in the area. Much used by the Belvoir Hunt during the hunting season from September to March, the area contains a number of small woods which have been deliberately maintained as fox coverts. The names of some woods actually indicate why they were originally planted, for example 'Waltham New Covert' south of the T.V. transmission mast. Other woodlands are utilised for the breeding of game birds. These tend to be on higher ground allowing the birds to be driven onto the guns which would be situated on lower ground outside the wood.
